alert.note: Alert for Burke; Columbia; McDuffie; Richmond (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 12:26PM EST until January 09 at 1:30PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern McDuffie County in east central Georgia... Columbia County in east central Georgia... Northwestern Burke County in east central Georgia... Richmond County in east central Georgia... Central Edgefield County in central South Carolina... South central Saluda County in central South Carolina... West central Aiken County in central South Carolina... Southeastern McCormick County in central South Carolina... * Until 130 PM EST. * At 1224 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Hamilton Branch State Park to 6 miles southwest of Harlem to near Davisboro, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... North Augusta, Grovetown, Evans, Thomson, Fort Eisenhower, Augusta, Martinez, Belvedere, Clearwater, Edgefield, Hephzibah, Harlem, Johnston, Glendale, Gough, South Augusta, Clarks Hill Recreation Area, Edgefield County Airport, Mistletoe State Park, and Summerville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in Georgia between mile markers 174 and 201. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 0 and 9. Interstate 520 in Georgia between mile markers 1 and 13. Interstate 520 in South Carolina between mile markers 17 and 23. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Severe thunderstorms can produce large capsizing waves and frequent lightning. If on or near Lake Strom Thurmond move away from the water and take shelter! A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for east central Georgia...and central South Carolina.
